content.rendered:
Looking for a great way to enjoy spring break?

With spring right around the corner, it is time to start thinking about those early season rafting trips!

In Arizona, the rafting season gets started early on the Salt River in early March. Don’t miss the opening day of Salt River Canyon on March 1st! Experience the spectacular whitewater rafting in Arizona. Here you will paddle through an incredible 2,000 foot deep canyon as you take on intense rapids such as Maytag, Overboard, and Mescal Falls. The Salt River drops at 20 feet per mile as it carves a gorgeous canyon full of deep wilderness and amazing discovery. Friends and  family will love this trip through the “little Grand Canyon”.

After a day of intense whitewater, kick back and enjoy a delicious guide-prepared steak dinner as you gaze upon gorgeous views of the high Sonoran Desert. The Salt River trips have a few trip options ranging from full day trips to 2 and 5 day overnight Arizona river trips.

Rapids range from class II to class IV whitewater levels. Check out the Salt River Arizona rafting trips on our website for more information.

Aside from early season rafting, there are quite a few other activities running during the month of March. One of our most popular early season activities is ziplining at our Idaho Springs outposts. Take a mountaintop zipline tour high above the snow covered forest for a truly unique experience.  Zipline tours are half day trips and courses are located in Idaho Springs, Colorado just 30 minutes from Denver and 45 minutes from Breckenridge and Keystone.

Right now through March 1, we're offering Buy One, Get One Half Off on March and April zipline tours – just use promo code BOGOZIPLINE13.  Visit our website for more information on pre-season and springtime adventure activities and great deals for the whole season!
